electricity available with box 4 adaptive plugs and 3

There are large sewers to evacuate gray water next to the parking lot and I think public services in the park.

In the town of Alange, overlooking the water reservoir of the same name. Next to the football stadium there is a large free esplanade where you park and spend the night. The town is famous among other things for the Roman baths very close, besides activities in the nature: canoes, trekking, etc. Surrounded by small mountains of great beauty.
Park with water fountain next to the esplanade.

title: (06909) Trasierra - BA-048

title: (06840) Alange - BA-005

title: (06280) Fuentes de León - Unnamed Road

title: (21380) Cumbres Mayores - Cam. de Enmedio
description: Very nice spring with great water. With large vehicles, choose the upper access road, sufficient turning possibilities.

title: (06475) Oliva de Mérida - EX-335
description: Place where I slept well, very quiet, no owls, no dogs.

title: (21387) Cumbres de Enmedio - Av. Andalucia
description: Perfect place to sleep and visit the town

title: (21388) Cañaveral de León - 1B Carretera Hinojales
description: Parking 24 hours. In July and August, they open a pool (called lagoon) with spring water. The price of parking is free. The price of the lagoon is free (donations are allowed, for maintenance). There is no light. In the vicinity of the lagoon, there is a drinking water tap. Restaurants, pharmacy, grocery store, bank. Recommended to spend a few days in the area.

title: (21388) Hinojales -
description: Viewpoint "el alto". Quiet place, next to a road with little traffic and with views of the Sierra de Aracena. The street is not very wide and the parking spaces are short, therefore you have to occupy a minimum of 2 so as not to stand out. It is also not a problem since it is a little frequented place and there are about 20 more parking spaces.

title: (06210) Torremejía -
description:
Park4Night urban-style dream. 
An industrialpark without industry (There is just one you can see on the satellite image). There are no signs that it is forbidden. Seems pretty silent. The highway is nearby but not really loud. And the streetlights don't switch on at night. Felt very safe sleeping here

title: (21386) Cumbres de San Bartolomé - 59 Diseminado Diseminados
title_short: (21386) Cumbres de San Bartolomé - 59 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Mirador with an unobstructed view of the valley.

title: (06260) Monesterio - A-66
description: Unusual large free parking with all 24h services you can think of like fuel, showers, toilets, waste water, free drinking water, “tons” of parking without height limit and everything is free of charge. Even night security personal patrolling the entire place. I talked to one and he confirmed that they tolerate sleeping over, as all lorry drivers do. Restaurant even open at night but pricy and busy. Free 4 G fast internet. All is run by the LEO Grupo, complejoleo.es. They obviously like you to consume a little;-) but no obligations. You can even check in into the hotel if you want 24/7. Some nightly sounds possible from lorries with running freezers but overall very quiet. So far the biggest and best I have encountered in Spain. One hour drive northwest of Seville :-)

title: (21386) Cumbres de San Bartolomé - H-V-2111
description: Picnic area, with tables, barbecues and a play area. Narrow entrance with stones, only advisable for camper.

title: (06170) La Albuera - 5 Carretera Badajoz Granada
description: Ample shaded parking in front of the municipal swimming pool, perfect for a night and tranquility despite the road.

title: (06170) La Albuera - Calle Avenida de Extremadura
title_short: (06170) La Albuera - Calle Avenida de Extremadura
description:
Nice picnic area with lots of tables under trees. Trash cans available. start of a little walk by the river under the bridge.
Parking is along a narrow road so not suitable for very wide motorhomes.

title: (06820) Don Álvaro -
description: Beautiful picnic area right on the river. Access is via 200m of narrow dirt track so suitable for small campervans but not motorhomes. Flat shaded area with picnic tables and bbq’s. We didn’t stay overnight but would definitely have liked to.

title: (06830) La Zarza - 26 Calle la Mina
description: Quiet area on the outskirts of town. It is a viewpoint with about three squares with good views and quiet.

title: (06906) Puebla del Maestre - 1 Plaza Manuel Durán
title_short: (06906) Puebla del Maestre - 1 Plaza Manuel Durán
description: Quiet place where you can spend several nights without any problem, there is a nearby pub where if you need something, they can help you and if you go in summer 50 meters away you have the public pool with stunning views

title: (06830) La Zarza -
description:
Quiet location next to an abandoned mine. Relatively flat, no blocks needed.
Has great sight over the surrounding area and some hiking tracks nearby.

The road is gravel but well maintained when coming from La Zarza

title: (06850) Arroyo de San Serván - s/n Calle Encarnación
title_short: (06850) Arroyo de San Serván - s/n Calle Encarnación

title: (06830) La Zarza - Paraje Villagonzola

We spent a very quiet Sunday night there with the sound of frogs. A tree under which to have shade for small jigs (Iveco Daily goes there). Otherwise a fairly flat concrete platform is not shaded. Thank you for respecting the villagers who clearly have their habits there :)

title: (06498) Lobón - 37 Avenida Adolfo Suárez

Gas station self-service restaurant ....... 230 meters. Self-service meal ....... 500 meters

title: (06498) Lobón -
description: 5 minutes off the main road lots of shade in the woodlands. (Some road noise) Lots of shade. Close to the river. Tracks down to the river for the fisher men. We are here in August possibly when it rains the might be muddy. 7metre plus van made it down the tracks into the clearings.

title: (06800) Mérida - 40 Avenida Constitución
description: The wash Lavandería is 200m away with easily accessible parking spaces. Very good condition of the machines. Clean place. Free WIFI. Phone charging stations. Payment is made with coins or banknotes. No credit card.

title: (06800) Mérida - Calle Sta. Teresa Jornet
description: Public parking, daily the same good but at the weekend all the kids go to have a bottle until the many. There is a park next door for dogs.

title: (06800) Mérida - 1A Calle Aguadores
